Class Piece

java.lang.Object
  Piece

public class Piece
extends java.lang.Object

Piece class is responsible for managing pieces of a torrent. State information of a piece, verification of a piece, and temporary storage as a piece is being assembled is provided here.

Constructor Summary
Piece(int pieceSize, byte[] correctHash)
          Constructs a Piece objects given the size of a piece and its correct SHA-1 hash
 
Method Summary
 void cleanup()
          If a piece has been completed, verified, and written to the disk, This method should be called in order to remove a reference to the temporary buffer so that the garbage collector can get rid of this space as soon as a piece is done.
 void clearBuffer()
          If the piece ends up bad, you may want to restart a piece state while keeping the correct hash.
 byte[] getBuffer()
          Returns piece buffer
 int getBytesWritten()
          Returns bytes written to this piece so far.
 int getPieceLength()
          Returns size of piece.
 boolean isDone()
          Returns current completion status of a Piece
 void setDone(boolean done)
           
 boolean verifyPieceHash()
          Verifies the piece data in the temporary buffer generating a SHA-1 hash, and comparing it to the correct hash expected, which was passed when the Piece object was first created.
 void writePiece(byte[] subpiece, int offset)
          Writes some part of a piece to the temporary buffer.
 
Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object
clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
 

Constructor Detail

Piece

public Piece(int pieceSize,
             byte[] correctHash)
Constructs a Piece objects given the size of a piece and its correct SHA-1 hash

Parameters:
pieceSize - Size of this piece
correctHash - Correct SHA-1 hash to be matched against the downloaded bytes
Method Detail

isDone

public boolean isDone()
Returns current completion status of a Piece

Returns:
Completion status of Piece.

setDone

public void setDone(boolean done)

cleanup

public void cleanup()
If a piece has been completed, verified, and written to the disk, This method should be called in order to remove a reference to the temporary buffer so that the garbage collector can get rid of this space as soon as a piece is done.

writePiece

public void writePiece(byte[] subpiece,
                       int offset)
Writes some part of a piece to the temporary buffer. This is here to keep a piece while it has not been completed or verified.

Parameters:
subpiece - piece data to be written to buffer
offset - offset of the buffer where we should start writing

clearBuffer

public void clearBuffer()
If the piece ends up bad, you may want to restart a piece state while keeping the correct hash. This method only reallocates a fresh buffer, and resets done and byteswritten data

verifyPieceHash

public boolean verifyPieceHash()
Verifies the piece data in the temporary buffer generating a SHA-1 hash, and comparing it to the correct hash expected, which was passed when the Piece object was first created.

Returns:
True if piece is correct (matches SHA-1), False otherwise.

getPieceLength

public int getPieceLength()
Returns size of piece.

Returns:
Size of this piece.

getBytesWritten

public int getBytesWritten()
Returns bytes written to this piece so far.

Returns:
number of bytes written so far

getBuffer

public byte[] getBuffer()
Returns piece buffer

Returns:
piece buffer
